titles.title: Coordinated Youth Education, Employment Training, and Residential Treatment Act of 2006

To authorize the Secretary of Education and the Secretary of Labor to make grants to advance treatment, education, and employment programs for youth with serious mental, psychological, behavioral, and emotional difficulties, so that they may obtain professional assistance necessary in order to be successful in their lives and contribute to the economy, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Select Education.

committee.name: House Committee on Education and the Workforce

bill.summary: 7/28/2006--Introduced. Coordinated Youth Education, Employment Training, and Residential Treatment Act of 2006 - Directs the Secretary of Education and the Secretary of Labor to make grants to Boys and Girls Home and Family Services, Inc., to establish programs and facilities for residential treatment, specialized education, and employment training and other appropriate levels of service to youth with serious mental, psychological, behavioral, and emotional problems.
